1 word "defendant" with "Ms. Maxwell." We tried to pick the ones which made sense, and I understand the Court did the same.

4

6 So I think our next one is not until -- I'm just checking with my colleagues -- is not until page 49, but give me one minute.
7

9

11
12 THE COURT: 44? Okay.
13 MR. EVERDELL: So this is line 4. We have the word "minors" again, right? This is a discussion of the elements of
14 the conspiracy, but, "Count One charges Ms. Maxwell with participating in a conspiracy" etc., etc. "to entice minors to travel and engage in sexual activity." And there are other instances of "minors" in line 15. It's "to transport minors."
15
16

18
19 THE COURT: So for all of these, this would be "an individual under the age of 17."
20
21 MR. EVERDELL: Well, yes. So it's going to be line 4, line 6, line 15, and line 19.
22
23 THE COURT: Mr. Rohrbach?
24 MR. ROHRBACH: That's fine, your Honor. And I would note in the next paragraph, there is a reference to "minor,"
